basics.name: Christian Komo
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in Fall 2027 and pursue a career in software and/or embedded engineering

work.company: University of Hawaii at Manoa Physics and Astronomy Department
work.summary: Advancing particle research by architecting web applications and other software systems
highlights: Developed frontend and REST API for a web application simulator supporting particle physics research at the University of Hawaii.
Credited with development of simulation software in research papers and conferences
Designed and engineered other electronic hardware and software systems for sensors and data monitoring

work.summary: Taught computer science to 70+ students in grades 1-6 across multiple schools in Oahu, introducing them to computational thinking.
highlights: Taught computational thinking using Python and block-based programming.
Introduced students to coding concepts and problem-solving skills.
Fostered a positive and engaging learning environment for young students.

volunteer.summary: Co-founded a robotics startup focused on agricultural tech, particularly in teleoperations and data collection on farms.
highlights: Developed business model and pitched startup idea to venture capitalists at Agtech Expo.
Collaborated with industry leaders to develop MVP.
Invited to Plug and Play accelerator in Silicon Valley to pitch our agricultural tech-based startup idea.

volunteer.summary: Collaborated with team members to process agricultural image data and run object detection models to optimize farm robotics.
highlights: Won 2nd place overall in the 2025 Farm Robotics Challenge, competing against 36 colleges.
Worked with team to process agricultural image data and run object detection models.
Analyzed model accuracy and precision with statistical measures.

volunteer.summary: Led event planning and organized student activities to boost ACM membership and engagement.
highlights: Planned and promoted ACM student events, including career fairs and club meetings.
Boosted club membership through strategic event coordination.

awards.title: Mānoa Academic Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded to first-year degree-seeking students based on high school academic performance and GPA. This scholarship supports students’ enrollment for up to four years and ranges from $2,000 to $4,000 per academic year.
